title: Larry King has been hospitalized with Covid-19
description: Legendary talk show host and former CNN interviewer Larry King has Covid-19, according to a source close to the family.

title: Outgoing GOP lawmaker to Republicans: Fear me
description: Rep. Denver Riggleman (R-VA) joins CNN's Ana Cabrera to discuss a plan by Senate Republicans to oppose the upcoming certification of President-elect Joe Biden's victory.

title: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic
8 extraordinary video moments from 2020
Harry Styles releases a new video and 'People' are, like, LOVING it
description: The year has scarcely begun, and ubiquitous pop star Harry Styles has saved it already with a stylish dance video for his new toe-tapper, "Treat People with Kindness."

title: Premier League stars condemned for Covid lockdown breach
description: Tottenham Hotspur has publicly criticized three prominent first team players for breaking coronavirus rules after they attended a Christmas party with their families.

title: Trump and Hawley set off Republican meltdown
description:
• Judge throws out lawsuit against Pence over electoral count
• Trump biographer on Pence: 'The most cringe-worthy display of bootlicking'
• Trump turns on allies in his final days in office

title: Cheerleader suspended for explicit Snapchat speaks out
description: A high-school cheerleader who didn't make varsity used four-letter words on Snapchat and was punished. Now the Supreme Court could decide whether schools can punish students for speech outside school.

title: Mauricio Pochettino takes charge at French powerhouse Paris Saint-Germain
UK emergency Covid-19 field hospitals asked to be 'ready' to admit patients as crisis looms
description: UK health workers are preparing to reactivate seven emergency Covid-19 field hospitals, as a surge of coronavirus cases fueled by the spread of a new, more contagious variant threatens to overwhelm intensive care units.

title: Concern mounts over government cyber agency's struggle to respond to hack fallout
description: With Microsoft acknowledging for the first time this past week that suspected Russian hackers behind a massive government security breach also gained access to its source code, pressure is mounting on US officials and cybersecurity experts to explain how the attackers infiltrated various US computer networks, what they did once inside and the steps that are being taken to mitigate the damage.

title: 'Everything is at stake': How abortion became a key issue in the Georgia Senate runoffs
description: Both opponents and supporters of abortion rights are investing heavily in the Georgia Senate runoff election next week, underscoring in their get-out-the-vote and fundraising efforts the crucial significance that a US Senate majority would offer each side as they look to advance their agenda under a new administration.

title: UK abolishes 'tampon tax' on menstrual products
description: The UK has abolished the 5% rate of value-added-tax (VAT) on menstrual products, known as the tampon tax.

title: How Trump made people care about politics again
description: Love him or hate him, President Donald Trump made most Americans feel strongly about politics in a way no politician has in our lifetimes. Record numbers of Americans felt strongly favorable or unfavorable toward Trump during his time in office. (The strongly favorable and unfavorable was 71% in a Fox News poll last month, for instance.)

title: Smerconish: Twin tests of democracy
description: After the Georgia runoffs and last-ditch efforts to overturn the election, will America turn the page to the new administration, or wallow in last year's grievances?

title: Can the Electoral College vote be upended?
description: What could happen during the Republicans' planned disruption of the Electoral College vote certification? 'It's got to be country over party -- or country over Trump,' says John Monsky.

title: Republican women in the House could change everything
description: On January 3, when members of the 117th Congress raise their hands and swear their oaths, a significant shift will take place. The number of Republican women in the House will more than double from 13 to at least 28 (two races are pending litigation). For a party historically known as "pale, male and stale," this increase is particularly meaningful.

title: Will the post-pandemic produce another 'roaring 20s'?
description: When the vaccine finally relieves the lockdown, will Americans respond by going wild?

title: A police officer paid for a family's Christmas groceries instead of charging two women with shoplifting
description: A Massachusetts police officer used his own money to buy Christmas dinner for a family in need instead of charging two women with shoplifting.

title: The Sunrise Movement is an early winner in the Biden transition. Now comes the hard part.
description: The Sunrise Movement, a youth-led climate activist group, has quickly announced itself as one of the most influential progressive forces in the formative days of President-elect Joe Biden's incoming administration.

title: As US inches closer to 350,000 Covid-19 deaths, one model projects about 115,000 more could die in next four weeks
description: The US topped 20 million total infections and inched closer to 350,000 Covid-19 deaths on the first day of 2021 -- reminders of a grim reality continuing into the new year.

title: More than 1,000 fines issued after illegal New Year's party in France breaches coronavirus restrictions
description: Five people have been arrested and more than 1,000 fines issued after an illegal New Year's rave in the French countryside ended on Saturday, local authorities said.

title: These are the volunteers who drove across the country to register voters in the Georgia runoff
description: It took one text from a friend to convince Graco Hernandez to drive thousands of miles to help in Georgia's election.

title: 12 books we're excited about this year
description: Pandemic reading means different things to different people.

title: Federal judge throws out Gohmert lawsuit asking Pence to interfere in Electoral College count
description: A federal judge has thrown out a lawsuit from Rep. Louie Gohmert of Texas and several Arizona Republicans seeking to force Vice President Mike Pence to help throw the election to President Donald Trump next week when Congress meets to count the Electoral College votes.

title: 2021 could see Britain ripped to pieces
description: On January 2, 2020, UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson tweeted that the following 12 months would amount to a "fantastic year for Britain." Instead, a global pandemic and the political turmoil of Brexit have stretched the social fabric of the United Kingdom to ripping point.

title: Execution date for the only woman on federal death row is reinstated
description: A group of three judges on the DC Circuit Court of Appeals ruled Friday that a lower court judge was wrong when he vacated an execution date for Lisa Montgomery, the only woman on federal death row.

title: US and Iran in war of words ahead of Soleimani killing anniversary
description: • Watch: How the US and Iran became enemies

title: US and Iran ratchet up military activity as concerns increase ahead of Soleimani killing anniversary
